poem:
Title: "The School Bell's Toll"

In the heart of England, stale time mends,
Victorian echoes in quills and pens.
"Our future," cries the scholar's drum,
"Intervenes the summer sun."

Boys of hopeful, girls of might,
Bound by four weeks of summer light.
A Nuffield plea; a different song,
Calls for shorter days, half-terms long. 

Thus alter, we may, the school-yard dance,
Yet, will it increase a child's chance?
